intro: Medica polymorpha, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, hairy, and often lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are followed by spiny, spherical fruits. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in fields. Medica polymorpha is also known for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic in high doses.
